poem:
**Diplomatic Struggle**

In the bathroom's quiet grip,  
Kate wrestles with orange loops,  
a diplomat ensnared,  
in silken diplomacy,  
seeking freedom in denim solace.  
  
Fasteners evade,  
like secrets whispered at grand tables,  
yet she longs for the jacket,  
a familiar armor against  
the whirl of delicate, binding schemes,  
to turn her passage back to work,  
once more a different kind of battle.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Diplomat season two review – effortlessly joins the list of 2024’s best TV In the bathroom of a plush function room, the US ambassador to the UK, Kate Wyler (Keri Russell), is struggling to take off her dress. She’s desperate to get out of this strappy orange cage so she can put on a jacket and jeans and get back to work. Eventually, unable to find a fastener among all the delicately interlocking loops". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: The Diplomat season two review – effortlessly joins the list of 2024’s best TV In the bathroom of a plush function room, the US ambassador to the UK, Kate Wyler (Keri Russell), is struggling to take off her dress. She’s desperate to get out of this strappy orange cage so she can put on a jacket and jeans and get back to work. Eventually, unable to find a fastener among all the delicately interlocking loops
